hk_princess

2010-06-01 07:51:08

Hi, I will like to share some of my stories with you. I used to be the girl who dresses up for the weather but this all changes last year when I have my boyfriend.

One day, my boyfriend mentioned he loves to see me shivering and cold, with goosebumps and blueish skins. He loves to see me with bare arms and legs. He also mentioned buying me a diamond ring if i will wear short sleeves/sleeveless top with mini skirts bare legs for the whole year even in winter. I love my bf so much that even without getting the diamond ring, I will wear just for him even if I gets really cold.

As I mentioned, I always dress for the weather, so the first time was extremely cold and I shivered uncontrollably.

It was a cold december night, and we had breaks from uni. My bf asked me out to a restaurant for dinner. I decided to dress in a short sleeves shirt with mini skirts and my converse shoe. So that my arms and my legs are all bare. The temperature that night was -3C. I could feel the cold when I walked from my house to his car and from his car to the restaurant. But it was for a short time so it was ok. During dinner, he mentioned how cute and beautiful I looked. I was very happy with his comments. We finished dinner about 8pm, and my bf suggested going to a beach for a evening walk and some chats. Since we only been dating for about 2 months, but we were both busy with uni stuffs, we thought having some chats will be good idea.

When we arrived at the beach, I could feel the extreme cold on my exposed bare skins once I opened the car door. The beach had some icy breeze and added to the already freezing temperature, it was just too cold for me with what i was wearing. By the time I opened the car door, goosebumps covered my arms and legs right away. Within 10 minutes I started shivering and my skin started turning blueish. When I was talking to my bf, he said my chattering teeth and my shivering made me so cute, and the goosebumps on my skins looked nice. I did not want to disappoint my bf so I decided to tough it out. After 30 mins, we decided to sit down, found a snowy ice cold bench. Due to not walking and direct contact of my skin with the snow, I was really really cold. I was shivering uncontrollably as we talked and getting to know more about each other personal stuffs. By one hour, I was so so so cold that it was hard for me to talk. My bf noticed my extreme shivering and extreme chattering teetch while we were talking. He took off his gloves and put his warm hand over my ice cold goosebumps blueish legs. He was a bit shock at how ice cold my legs were and asked me if I was really really cold. I told him I was but the time we spent together was worth it. He offered his jacket to cover my bare arms and started rubbing my legs with his hand. It made me little bit warmer but not much as I was still very exposed and little clothings but the ways he hugged me and rubbing my legs were nice. After another 2 hours of chats, he could see I was very very cold, and we decided to go home.

Three hours in the cold snowy beach with icy breeze really pushed my body to my limits. I had never shiver so much before and also hav maximum goosebumps possible. I had never had my skins ice cold to touch before. But it was a good experience and some good chats with my bf, despite the coldness. It was worth it.

Hi, I get it that a lot of guys like us girls to show a lot of bare skin in the winter cold. When I wear very little my skin turns a bit red or blueish after some time and I start to shiver, but I don't care, I have no problems freezing as I feel sexy because skimpy clothes simply look better. From my point, guys do very well have a close look at our goosebumps and shivering muscles, as they show off your slim body ;-) Why would one hide it under thick layers? Only if a girl had something to hide...;-) So I am a bit proud to show my flat stomach and my hip bones, my slim legs, shoulders and arms because I have worked out hard for it. My thin body makes me feel the cold a lot more than an average normal-sized girl. But the message is, hey, look there guys, I am cool enough to tough it out, I like feeling sexy (and thus being cold, hehe)! No matter how much I freeze, I stay outside in minimal summer clothing, even if I get sick, that does not stop me. It is my style! And by the way, my boyfriend likes to see me (and show me off :-)) skimpily dressed, cold and shivering and revealing a lot of skin, too. Last winter he mentioned that he loves it when I deny that I am sick although I am obviously coughing and sneezing, just to be able to still go out skimpily dressed with him. He said he loves it when I go out in the freezing cold, wearing next to nothing and shivering uncontrollably with bluish skin and huge goosebumps despite being sick. He also said that he loves it when I get wet in the freezing rain, such that my nipples protrude the thin material of my wet and almost transparent top, while I try to suppress my uncontrollable shivering, sneezing, and coughing through chattering teeth. Does your boyfriend like you to get wet in the cold rain, also your hair? Of course I am not supposed to towel off then, which I tough out to not disappoint him despite being even colder with dripping wet hair, body, and clothes in the ice cold wind. Of course you feel a lot colder when you are sick, but you get used to it and in the end it is not that big difference. Some guys find my cough and sneezing sexy and offer me a kleenex or buy me a hot coffee g. Sometimes I shock them replying that I would rather have an ice-cream ;-).

Princess, I understand that you do not wear much clothing in the cold either ;-). Your experience going out in just a short shirt and mini skirt on a frosty night is amazing! You must have been the center point of attention. Do you wear any underwear? Stupid question, as this does not fit in with your erotic clothing style. I do not wear any either, just no space left under a lowrise jeans/skirt or a tight-fitting top ;-). Too bad that you took your boyfriend's jacket. You should really have toughed it out with bare arms and legs if you really love him. You would not have been much colder without his jacket anyway. Perhaps you could even have taken something more off to please him, you were at the beach after all, what do you think? What about a dip in the sea, (dressed would have been ok since you hadn't been knowing each other for long)? Will you continue to go out bare-legged in short miniskirts and just tiny skimpy tops without jacket in cold nasty weather? Have you tried to go bare-footed, or at least with bare feet in sandals or flip-flops? Will you reveal a lot of skin even if the sub-zero weather makes you freeze your buns off? I guess that's what guys find very sexy about us! Did you get sick from going out in minimal clothing? This is a matter of getting used to the cold over time and building up resistance. Do you continue to go out wearing next to nothing in subzero weather when you are sick? Does your boyfriend like that?

Ciao, Lissy

I have to amend that not only men like to see barely dressed women in the cold - at least some women also do.

My own tolerance towards the cold is somewhat limited. If it's too cold I opt for a longer skirt, pantyhose, even trousers and a jacket or a coat; on the other hand I don't tolerate such clothing on my girlfriend Nicole.

I want her to wear always the least possible amount of clothes - especially in winter!

Bare legs and bare belly are a must that is never discussed. If it's only cold but neither raining nor too windy it's also bare arms and shoulders or a completely backless top.

It's so sexy to see her almost bare in bad weather trying to stand it. She's very sweet and cute and seeing her exposed to the elements makes her look even cuter and sexier.

She really copes well with the cold but she's always trying to challenge me by putting on too much. I then either threaten to punish her or - what has proved to be very effective - I tell her it's OK but I'm soo disapointed...

I think it is the contrast between the weather and the clothing that attracts attention, and a girl demonstrates self-confidence and coolness when she sticks to her style, no matter what the circumstances are. Hence, I do not let the cold stop me from wearing what I want and enjoy. Consequently, I do not dress any warmer when I am sick. How does Nicole react to being sick? Hi Ferfred,

when boys go out with me, they often want me to wear skimpy clothes despite cold weather. I think they love to watch whether I can take the cold and how long I am able to brave it. Since I don't eat very much to stay slim, I don't mind if they don't take me out for dinner. If we do not eat at all during a night out, it's okay. I may be hungry, but I have learned to ignore my famine. Some people notice and worry that I don't eat, but since they also admire my skinny body, I tell them that I have to diet to stay slim. Since I have no protection against the weather, I catch a cold quite often during winter, but then again I think it's not more frequent than anybody else. A little cold doesn't make me change my clothing style, so I will wear as little as always, even if I have a fever, because boys would be disappointed if I didn't show bare legs, arms and a lot of bare skin on a date, which I am known to do. Maybe I wear even less or undress a bit to cool down my hot body temperature ;-) Last week I had quite a cough that made my lungs hurt and a fever, but I had a date with a guy I had met some days before. Although I barely knew him, he seemed to be quite nice, so when I woke up that morning with a headache, sniffles and that cough that had worsened considerably since the days before, there was no way canceling the date and make him miserable. But I didn't want to cancel it anyway, on the contrary, I was quite keen on going out that night to have fun after a long working week and feel the fresh cold air on my bare skin. I felt colder than usual, the well-known shivery feeling when you develop a fever. He asked me if we should better cancel the date, but I replied that I was okay and kissed him on the cheek. In fact, I am just warm enough. And you would be freezing! Atchie!" "Bless you. Are you hungry?" "No thanks, I have to loose some pounds, don't you think?" "Err..no.." Stinging stare from me "...yes! I cleared my sore throat and sneezed again, all the way looking at him, mouth half open, blue quivering lips pouted, erotically batting my eyelashes. I just asked the latter if they rather wanted me to be warm and healthy and cover up. No one wanted :) I could see how my date was more and more turned on by the looks and comments, and so was I! And freeze :) I nearly froze to death but at the same time have never been so alive before! He walked me home in the early morning, and I fell on my bed. Sweet, cold shivering dreams! I think I still shivered when I woke up the next morning :). I enjoyed that night very much, although I was still feverish when I had to go to work on Monday, but that's no problem for me. Maybe it has to do with me ice skating on Sunday? ;-)

Ferfred, there are many other situations, also when it was very cold, but I can't tell them all here :-) What do you want to know specifically? You could push a number of them gently into your most private part before putting on your shorts to cool you down from the inside. How many cubes can you take? well, perhaps I'll find time to write some more. As you can imagine, I really like to go out, which I often do, so I am quite happy when a guy asks me out. However, since I'm not at home and writing then... You are right, I'm looking carefully after my figure. I don't eat very much and rather drink water, coffee or tea, which you could call some kind of diet, but I don't follow any classic dieting rules. I work out, though, mostly swimming in the lake (all year, of course). But just for burning calories, because I don't want to grow muscles and want my body to stay clearly feminine. Some people might think I could be underweight, but I am not since I feel great and fit and really like my body. And most guys like what they see and feel, at least I haven't heard of any complaints :). I don't eat before having a date, because we are supposed to have dinner during the date :) But it's also fine if it turns out that we don't eat at all, because there's no time left, we change our plans, or have better things to do :). On most of my dates, we only have some drinks anyway. If I am invited, I don't eat much because I don't want to take advantage of the boy who pays, maybe a salad or an appetizer. I don't do anything special to warm up after a freezing night out, just take a cold shower, or, time permitting, a cold bath (which feels warm when I am cold, a hot shower would boil me!), then lie on my bed and shiver :) Well, sometimes a guy does his best to warm me up again. Certainly I don't mind to lend him a hand, then :) By the way, I sleep in the nude, window open, without blankets, because I easily get hot at night and don't like clinging, stifling pyjamas or covers. Although we did some skiing, we went there primarily for the after ski parties, and as you might already guess, I never brought a jacket, scarf, hat, mittens, trousers, vest, sweater or longsleeve for skiing and even less so for the party nights. Especially the way back to our hotel in the early morning hours was quite cold and I shivered immediately we left the bar, but I didn't cover up or urged my friends to hurry up. I stayed a few feet behind the group with one of my friends and watched the beautiful stars shining bright in the moonlit sky in that crisp and clear night. He asked if I wasn't cold and offered me his jacket. I cleared my throat that had been itching since around noon and replied through chattering teeth that I was indeed very cold but that I didn't care and there was no reason to dress warmer, unless he didn't like what he saw. You imagine his bewildered reaction :) I stifled a cough and my nose started tingling slightly. I knew that I was getting a cold, which I might have caught in the icy head winds on the slopes that were assisted by a steady stiff easterly breeze. Being not the best at skiing (we went there to party in the first place :)), I had tumbled into the snow several times, wetting myself completely, including my dripping wet hair that was already frozen at the ends. My sheer short top had become soaking wet and transparent, exposing a good part of my breasts, my rock-hard aroused nipples poking through the thin fabric. My shorts felt like an ice cold sponge on my freezing soft skin that was covered in huge bluish goosebumps, but the icy wet fabric between my slender legs made my hard, big $%!@ tingling with heat. You can imagine how cold in the wind and at the same time hot and wound-up I was! I could no longer suppress my ever-intensifying shivering and moaned quietly as a shudder that originated from my most sensitive parts gripped me. The shudder quickly evolved into a whole body convulsion before I could regain control of my muscles. That is, until am explosive sneeze followed by the first coughing fit of my developing cold made my body nearly tumble again. I hardly kept my balance. I knew that I would soon be very ill with fever if I continued to stay outside, wet in next to nothing in the sharp frost, but I was so aroused that I just toughed it out and enjoyed, as always. It was simply out of question to dress warmer and ruin my look, go inside, or even cross my arms for warmth, and I didn't waste a thought. For the time being, the cold air stroking my bare wet skin kept my body temperature down so that my fever wouldn't get too high. When I had to cough again I asked my friend for a cigarette, which in addition to deadening my cough numbs my stomachic nerves and helps me ignore my undue sensation of hunger. I smoked half a pack with passion taking deep drags, trying to subdue coughing and sneezing by closing my chattering mouth and tensioning my shivering muscles, while I felt my wet shorts between my legs rubbing me higher and higher as I get colder and colder. Finally, when we arrived at the hotel, my wet clothes were steaming in the cold night air and my breath came out in clouds when I was coughing or sneezing, both clearly visible against the moonlight.

Love, Lissy

"Mainly straight" means that I also find it inspiring to watch slim girls shivering in the cold, wearing too little for the sake of looking good. However, it destroys the magic for me if they don't tough it out and cover up.

--Second, If i were a man, I wish to see you being in the cold with goosebumps and shivering, but at the same time I will worry about your health, sort of complicate emotions! XP

It is very kind of you that you worry about my health and I really appreciate that, but there's no reason for worries. Many people who see me for the first time ask me if I don't catch my death, but if they get to know me better they get used to my clothing style and no longer bother. When I am ill, I don't let this spoil my day. I want to have fun and go out in the cold rain or snow nevertheless, wearing the same attire as usual. I am so high on adrenaline then that I don't feel the cold, my hurting chest, or headache that much, so there's no reason for covering up. In fact, I think that exposing my body to the winter weather and being cold and shivering helps to bring down my fever.

--So if I were a guy I wish to warm you by putting my arms around your shoulder and hug you tightly! And "keep you warm" tho it doesn't really help!

And if you were (are :-)) a girl?

--Third, I guess the reason of your death must be freeze to death, as it seems you really love the cold no matter what!

I don't hope so :) Although I admit that I have been close to hypothermia or perhaps could have been mildly hypothermic several times. I guess this is what a girl has to endure for beauty, and I'm up for it. Real beauty knows no pain!

Hi Goblia,

I don't follow any special plan, I just try to eat not that much. Hence, I don't eat between meals, no sweets, no soft drinks. I have a cup or two of black coffee or tea without milk for breakfast, followed by a small salad or some fruit for lunch (e.g., a mandarine, water melon, grape, or lemon, but beware of high-calorie fruit like bananas, apricots, or even raisins!). When I have a lot of work to get done, it is common for me to skip lunch and work during the lunch break. Be sure to drink at least six pints during the day to keep you stomach filled. To this end, I also drink black coffee or water. Whenever you are hungry, drink instead of eating. For tea I have - tea! Again without milk, and beware of sweet biscuits (cookies :)). Ok, maybe one sugar-free low-fat biscuit. My next and final meal for the day is dinner, which consists of a salad with vinegar dressing (no oil!) and a big glass of water, or maybe a glass of red wine on saturday. In addition, you should work out, but no strength training as this would only grow your muscles, you don't want to look like a body builder do you. A final advice: Be shivering cold, I mean really freezing cold with bluish skin and goosebumps all over, always. Wear as little as possible and stay wet all the time, including your clothes and hair. This keeps your metabolism up as your body burns a lot of calories trying to stay warm and keep its core temperature at 37C (or more when you have a fever :)). What does your body look like? Do you like to show off your thin long legs and arms, thin waist, flat tummy, rib cage, shivering hip bones and shoulder blades in a sleeveless, bare-legged, and bare midriff low-rise attire? If you want to loose some more weight for a really sexy slim figure, burn more calories by bringing your core body temperature below 37C. The adrenaline that rushes your body when you freeze very badly in next to nothing feels really good :), especially with all the looks you get for your scantily clad sexy super thin bony killer body. Thus, swimming in cold water, maybe in the sea or a lake nearby, is an appropriate workout. Don't be afraid of hypothermia, just stay in the water when you feel that you can no longer suppress or control your shivering, it'll get weaker again. Leave the water only when your shivering ceases. When you warm up afterwards, you'll start to shiver again, which is normal, because your metabolism ramps up again raising your temperature, and burning all those nasty calories.

Love, Lissy

2012-02-20 16:41:05

1-2 cups of coffee, black = breakfast small salad or fruit or nothing = lunch salad, even without oil = dinner

everyone can live and die like they want, have a diet that makes them stay anorexic and go out freezing and hypothermic if they are ill and invite kidney and lung problems.

but this is not advice to give a girl that is still in school and growing.

if someone is healthy, not ill and feverish, an hour of shivering will do no harm. but to be constantly cold and on the brink of hypothermia is a total other kettle of fish.

also, if someone is doing sports and avoiding too much sugar, you can eat healthy and normal, with lots of fruit, even raisins, and vegetables without worrying about calories. avoid too much chemicals in your food, which means no industry food, cook and season yourself and if you can't, go learn it, that way you eat cheaper and more healthy.

bathing in cold water aka ice bathing is healthy, go look at youtube vids about that. but - those swimmers don't stay in until they are shivering uncontrollably.

if you just want to make yourself shiver - that actually works in water the temp. of 20 degrees. if you sit in it and don't move, you will shiver.

Callen

Callen
44
2012-02-23 11:55:58

Hi Goblia,

is it your goal to get ill or is it your goal to shiver? In my experience, if you are healthy to start with, shivering doesn't get you ill. A cold is a result of a virus, not the cold. The cold becomes a problem for your health if you're letting yourself get hypothermic. But as long as you shiver - that is no problem. Hypothermia starts when you are so cold that your body can't shiver anymore. So when you stop shivering, that is, when you have to worry. A healthy body can shiver for hours, even days. But constant cold will weaken your body, so then you might get a virus, because your body has no energy left to fight it.

Also, your thinking processes slow down way before you become hypothermic. There are videos of tests, where someone after even shivering uncontrollably for half an hour, needs more time to do some simple math.

There are lots of videos on the net about hypothermia. Knowing what you're doing is the best to prevent true damage to your health. For example: google dr. popsicle from kanada :-)

So: if you go out shivering for the fun of it, it won't be a problem. If you are ill, have a cold to start with, it is possible to get worse, inflammation of the lung for example. My advice: don't do the shivering thing when you are ill. When you are healthy, there is no harm in going out and shiver.

One more thing: shivering uncontrollably also makes you react very slow physically on top of the slow thinking, so it might be a good idea to have someone with you, who can help you if you let yourself become too cold.

Then the shivering can truly be fun for you and maybe someone, who is with you and enjoys watching and feeling the shivering.

:-)

XXXGoblia shiverXXX
45
2012-02-23 17:11:30

Yush my aim is to shiver, but sometimes I don't feel the cold :) I'll keep reading your tips etc NEVER STOP WRITING!!

Callen
46
2012-02-24 10:51:27

this might not be the right place to talk about this. the topic is changing from cold for beauty to cold for pleasure. you could contact me in private if you want.

If not, just go to youtube, there are lots of vids on how to do icebathing, and hypothermia from dr. giesbrecht (dr. popsicle).

as I said, just for the pleasure of shivering you don't neet to go to extremes (only if you want to). for example: sit/stand in cold water in shower or bathtub or stand outside in the cold without moving for 10 min., maybe drink something cold too, then go inside for 10 min., drink something hot, then go outside again, the changing confuses your body, you'll get cold a lot faster.

or stand outside in weather 3 to 12 degrees, light clothing or bikini, spray yourself with some cold water, stand relaxed without moving, you'll shiver. if it's colder than 0 degrees, you'll not need water. drink something hot or cold while standing outside, you'll shiver. if there's wind (or you have a fan) you'll shiver even faster.

:-)

lissy w.
56
2012-03-09 21:12:27

Hi Fred,

--Do you also drink less when you have a date?

I don't drink so much that it would bulge my stomach ;-) However, regardless of how much you eat, you have to drink enough to keep your electrolytes balanced and your kidneys happy. Hence, my stomach might not be as flat or concave as it could be when I have drunk, but I think you would hardly notice.

--Do you prefer to avoid situations where people eat or do you don't mind being around others who have a nice dinner?

I don't mind if people have dinner around me, certainly everybody may eat as much as they want ;-) Likewise they don't mind my eating habits, I think most of them don't even notice.

--Do you choose those or just a side salad without a dressing?

Depends on how hungry I am, but I never eat until I am literally full. Basically I like all kinds of salads if they're made without oil or meat. For me, salads mustn't be drowned in dressings of any kind, either.

--Did you have any special situations in this time?

I don't know what you consider "special" ;-). Since I always go out dressed rather skimpily, I don't think this is special for me. During the cold spell I wore pretty much the same as always, short (mini-)skirt or hot pants and short sleeveless tops, for example. I also smoked a cigarette or two outside as usual during breaks, without covering up. When I went out for the night, I stayed outside as usual walking through the city or between clubs. I attended some outdoor events (sports, concerts) as well, and did some ice skating and cross-country skiing as I mentioned before. I was very cold and could not always control my shivering. In fact, I shivered a lot and at times even my teeth chattered, but I tried my best to hide it. People seemed to contemplate my clothing style a bit more than usual given the very low temperatures. On the other hand, I received even more compliments ;-).

--Did you go for your usual swimming routing and what did you wear?

Yes I did, because I want to stay fit. Well, what do you wear when you go for a swim, not much I think ;-). If people are around for a stroll or walking the dog at "my" lake, I wear a string bikini, which I sometimes shed when I'm in the water or they're at a safe distance or don't mind to see a lady in her birthday costume. If I'm alone I prefer to skinny-dip anyway.

Love, Lissy

Hi Goblia,

--And also, Lissy, if a man puts his jacket on you, do you hand it back to them or keep it??

Since a jacket will almost always ruin my outfit g, I politely refuse his offer and give it back to him. After all, the reason to walk around in skimpy clothes despite the cold is to brave the elements and show your body, isn't it? If the guy is nice, I offer him to join me for a drink, though. ;-) Do you wear a jacket when you're offered one? How do you react? Do you ever wear a jacket, e.g., when you are ill?

Love, Lissy

Potdem
60
2012-06-16 06:45:51

Hi winter lovers,

You should live in eastern Canada (e.g. Quebec province), here you can enjoy real dry & white winters!

I live in Montreal and for us 0C is not considered as cold (not warm either, just between both): you can still see some people going with bare legs in the streets.

When temperatures drop below -10 or -15C there are only a few who go bare legged (except girls for clubbing), however you might still meet a few in -20 or -25C weather (both genders, females in skirt and males in shorts) (such cold days are not that frequent in Montreal).

Search for "Montreal winter bare legs" or "Montreal winter bare legs Igloofest" in Gooogle Images (Igloofest is an outdoor festival in January; despite the -20 or -30C temperatures with wind chill, there are some people who remain outdoor bare legged or topless all night long!).

Personally my limit of comfort is -20C to go bare legged and -10C to go barefoot i.e. shoeless (with a limit of 1 or 2 hours if there is some snow in the ground). I'm not a 24/7 barefooter but I enjoy to do so even in winter (I've only met two other winter barefooters in Montreal).

Posted by shiverfan on 2012-07-11 21:09:51:

zugger do you have any good stories to share?

I have to say, I have nothing that could compare by any means with what you are living with Elizabeth. I can't wait to read about the third assignment.

There are some cool stories and experience reports here on MP but I'm pretty sure you already know them all.

As for proper experience: My wife is very sensible for the cold, so she would never do something like that.

The last memorable experience is from this winter: I was traveling in the Swiss Alps. At one point I had to change from one train to another, a very small one. This was at about 2,300m of altitude. You had to walk over snow and ice from the main station to another train line some 150m away. There were two local girls who were totally not dressed for the climate with short skirts and ballerina shoes. Unfortunately both wore (thin) tights. One of them was only wearing a really light jacket. They were chatting quite happily (That's how I learned they were locals) like if it were completely normal to be dressed liked this in the middle of the mountains with 1.50m of snow everywhere. Everyone else was wearing boots, gloves, heavy coats or jackets.

The second train was really old, rather historic, and did hardly have any heating (or none at all, I'm not sure) but the two girls were absolutely unimpressed. When it reached its destination about 20 minutes later they got out and started walking away (I don't know where to) through the snow.

I do post stories that I find memorable from time to time, but as I said, I've got nothing that compares to yours.

gfx
107
2012-07-24 12:07:52

Hey guys, I am new to Mister Polls. In case you want some background about me, I am a Korean girl living in New York. I really enjoy all the stories on this thread and it's great to see that so many girls like myself enjoy braving the cold :) I feel like I should share my stories with you guys too!

It all started about 3 years ago when I was 18 and had my first boyfriend. Back then, I dressed like any other typical girl. However, my boyfriend wanted to change this because he really liked to see girls shivering with goosebumps and redish/blueish skin. With my boyfriend around, I started wearing less and less gradually.

During Christmas, my boyfriend gave me a special gift :) When I opened it, I found an extremely thin tank top and a 6-in. micro mini skirt. I loved my boyfriend and when I saw this, I thought of the perfect surprise. I called him and asked him for dinner tonight. I decided to surprise him by wearing nothing outside but what he gave me which was a paper-thin tank top and a very short micro skirt in the middle of winter (I also had high heels on) xD I knew I would be really cold but I decided that I should brave it to impress him.

Because it was the first time I wore so little clothing (although I have worn skirts in the winter prior to this), I was extremely cold and shivered uncontrollably the moment I walked out of my house. The temperature that night was about 10F (-12C). As we walked to the restaurant, I could feel every bit of cold and was covered in huge goosebumps with my nipples sticking up and my skin was turning bluish. I received a lot of looks and we met a friend who was surprised by my new style and asked if I was cold and I told her I was fine. During dinner, my boyfriend told me this was the best surprise he has ever seen, saying how he loved seeing me shiver and cold in minimal clothes and wished I could do this the entire winter. I told him I will grant him his wish and he kissed me in joy.

After dinner, my boyfriend suggested to have a nice walk with me in Central Park. Once again, I was freezing cold and shivering uncontrollably during the entire walk. That night, the wind in Central Park was extremely strong. My teeth soon began to chatter and my boyfriend told me I am the cutest and sexiest girl he has ever known which made me extremely happy. We spent about an hour in Central Park, walking and taking pictures and sitting down having a nice talk in which I was talking with chattering teeth. By this time, I was unbearably cold but I still decided to tough it out because my bf is so awesome. Just to my luck, it started to snow and the snow fell right on my bare arms and legs making me even colder. My tank top and micro skirt were completely wet and my nipples kept poking out of the paper thin fabric of my shirt more and more. My hair also started to form some sort of ice . My boyfriend noticed how cold I must've been and took off his gloves to feel my bare legs. He shivered at the touch of my legs and said I was as cold as the snow. My bf then kinda felt bad and offered me his gloves and jacket to which I denied and said that all I wanted was a long warm hug with him :) We had a good hug which got me a bit warmer. We stayed around in the snow for a bit longer and then decided to take the bus home. People on the bus were shocked to see how little I was wearing when I came on lol

When I got home, it took me almost half an hour to get my hands and feet unnumb. The next day, I started getting sick. Oddly enough, I really enjoyed it and it was a day I'll never forget. In fact, I did not mind being sick, I still wore the least clothes possible and felt the cold even more :) Whenever I feel the cold breeze on my skin and see all the stunned looks, I feel so sexy xD

Last year, I decided to clean out my wardrobe and get rid of/donate all my jackets and jeans and basically anything other than thin tank tops, short dresses, mini-skirts, and short shorts/hot pants so I wouldn't have the temptation of warm clothes in the winter. My boyfriend is living with me now and he was extremely happy to see me do that :) I was able to go the entire winter with minimal clothing, even when it was snowing, all I could wear outside was a tank top and mini-skirt. Sure, my body did get really cold but I enjoyed every second of it! I am really looking forward to this winter as the summer is too hot even with minimal clothes.

@shiverfan: the coldest I've ever experienced was probably when I went on a trip to Montreal with a couple of friends in the middle of winter. There was one day where it was probably -20C (-10F). The only clothes I brought with me were tank tops, backless dresses, hot pants, and miniskirts. My friends also did not bring any warm clothes. I had no choice but to go bare legs and bare arms in absolutely freezing weather. The moment I walked outside my hotel, I already had huge goosebumps and chattering teeth. We did not walk on the streets for too long but my body was already freezing cold. If I stayed out for any longer, I wouldv'e probably been at risk of hypothermia. 120
2012-07-29 19:37:27

@daewongkim: same here. Have you ever been to Korea? I went there one summer and I loved it! I really admire their fashion and culture and not to mention, I love kpop :D

You get goosebumps whenever you feel cold. The size of the goosebumps depends on how cold your body feels. Usually, the coldest parts of your body will get more intense goosebumps. It also had to do with blood supply which is why ppl don't get goosebumps on their face or foot compared to arms and legs. Technically, goosebumps can appear on any part of the body. I am very thin and barely have any arm or leg hair so when I go outside in the winter bare arms and bare legs, I get cold pretty easy and get pretty large goosebumps. I don't really like the feeling of goosebumps, it just helps your body brave the cold :D

Potdem
130
2012-08-01 02:58:49

"@shiverfan: the coldest I've ever experienced was probably when I went on a trip to Montreal with a couple of friends in the middle of winter. There was one day where it was probably -20C (-10F)."

I live in Montreal and I go bare legged all the time (with a winter coat, hat, gloves, boots). Bare legs in -20C remains very comfy once you get used to it, even for several hours. People's stares are very funny tough - they stare you and feel cold for you, while you just don't feel any cold on your legs.

About the rest of the body, this is another story. Once I remained 45 min outside in -20C weather wearing a thin tee-shirt (plus shorts as usual and winter boots). I was feeling completely fine until I went into a warm place (i.e., the metro) and then felt cold and start shivering for about 15 min.

I tried barefoot a couple of times but the risk is real, although I've been told that a very few barefooters do remain barefoot all the time in Montreal (however I assume they won't stand in the deep snow for 2 hours in -25C blizzard).

daewongkim11
131
2012-08-01 22:18:00

So, just curious what is everyone's favorite story of somebody they know that was shivering with goosebumps etc.?

Mine is I had a friend who is always cold but she rarely wore warm clothing, especially when it was summer and air conditioning can be really intense. Well she came to school in a short sundress with her arms and back all exposed and the average temperatures of the room was around 65 degrees. Well she would always come visit me during my English lab which I did online and we would hang out in the room, just the two of us and she froze this particular day. She had goosebumps all over her arms and legs and she would not stop shivering. I personally didn't do anything to make her cold but I couldn't help but feel very excited and happy by the situation and since she is very touchy and affectionate to everyone, spent the entire lab in each other's arms! Fortunately I work fast so I could make up my actual work quite fast! ;)

Hey everyone, ok so following up more in-depth on my question of what is everyone's favorite story, I have a more detailed story about my favorite incident. Again what is everyone's favorite shivering/goosebumps story?

Well mine kind of goes like this:

I am a student and when I was in high school I had an college level English lab I took online through a local university and I would be given time during the school day to work on it. I had a friend who had a free period that same time and since I worked really well and really fast generally I could get a week's worth of work done in a day. However she would come and visit me on a regular basis. She's a beautiful girl with long brown hair and an incredible body, a bit on the more husky set but I feel that her look is perfect for her, and she gets cold SO easily. Several times I remember sitting there next to her and it could be like 80 in the room and she'll be wearing a sweatshirt and all of a sudden she'll shudder from cold and start chattering her teeth. Well for some reason she decided to make her senior year of high school a "less is more" kind of thing. She only wore short dresses and shorts to school and at very least, very short t-shirts, often tank tops even in winter. Often we would be in class and she would be talking to me and she would have goosebumps all over her arms. I think she had goosebumps more often than not that year. She said that it always felt like she had pins in her arms and legs from the constant goosebumps and when it got late at night and colder she would sit in her house shaking violently rubbing her arms for warmth but would never get a coat or blanket.

Well this particular day was unbelievably amazing. I went to English lab and she came in with a sleeveless sun dress, exposing her arms, shoulders, back, and legs. I saw goosebumps immediately before she even got close to me. I asked her if she was cold and she replied "I'm freezing dear" and kissed me on my cheek. She shuddered and rubbed her arms up and down then asked if I would warm her. Her skin was ice cold and every single millimeter of her skin was covered in goosebumps all over. I asked her if she was ok and she said that she wasn't feel well and was getting chills. She said that it was the kind of cold where "your teeth chatter so hard for so long you're afraid you'll break a tooth." Well I apparently was her hero because I cuddled her the whole period and since i"m always warm to begin with, certainly made her very happy.

I hope you enjoyed my story, please feel free to share your own. Also could you also copy responses to daewongkim@yahoo.com and send any links or photos you have of goosebumps and shivering that would be much appreciated! Thanks everyone!! :)

I grew up in a forest area in an old farm house with no other house in sight. My clothing limits started when I was 9. When I got out of the car I always put something on. I guess my parents would have been ashamed if they were seen with a bottomless girl. In school I had to wear always quite short dresses or skirts. I think my parents tried to break my will but didn't succeed. They always thought that at some point I was going to be embarassed or ashamed. When I was naked with my family it was just comfortable and I liked being different and challenging, but now it's different - I love the looks and comments I get and I love it even more to make the guys hot.

There is where I also most times lost my clothes. Natually I had to put on clothes for school. I had tried not to, but I was not allowed.

To go to school, I had to cross a small forest and walk over some fields to the village. In my school many knew that I was naked at home. One day when I had 11 years 4 boys from the school walked with me over the fields and then asked: "Is it right you are naked at home?" I said "yes" and they asked "Do you like it?" And again I said "Yes, much".

They stayed at a short distance so they could watch me, but always when I came nearer to them they ran away a bit more but when I went away they followed me. After a while I gave up and went home. They followed me until I reached home. I didn't have problems with my family. I usually undressed before going into the house. It was a very funny feeling when I walked naked and they watched me. I was very angry that the boys had my clothes but I had a strange feeling in my belly and my $%!@. Now I know I was horny, but then I did not know that.

When we met they told me I can have my shoes and dress back if I give them my panties. I said OK and took of my panties and we changed things. After that they asked if I wanted to walk with them naked again. I said yes, but I keep my clothes with me. I said yes and they said: "Give them now or in the afternoon we will take all your clothes and not give them back." I was afraid of that, because I did not have many clothes and my family would know after a while if a dress was gone, so I did give them my panties. I then had lost two of them. It was very funny in school, to not wear nothing under my dress and nobody knew.

I met the boys again after school. They did not give me my panties back but still I walked naked with them, but again I keeped my clothes with me.

The next day it was saturday and then sunday and I was naked all the time. On monday I thaught I will not loose more panties and leaved them at home. When the boys met me they were surprised. I thaught they liked that I was not wearing panties but they had also liked to take things from me, so it was part good part bad for them.

From then I did not wear panties to school until the end. One day my sister found out and she told my mom. My mom got very angry, and said I must wear panties to school, but I said no. Lynne Cox also swam a mile in the Antarctic Ocean. She wrote a book all about her cold water swimming career, called "Swimming to Antarctica". In that there's a great chapter about her discovery that she loved being cold one day at school in the open-air pool during a hailstorm when she was allowed to stay in. All the other kids left the pool but she loved the feeling of the icy hailstones falling on her head and back. She felt they'd all missed something wonderful.

I discovered the same when I was at primary school. The teachers thought I was mad when I took clothes off to go outside at breaks instead of putting on more. It's a feeling I've never lost even four decades later. My friends have sort of got used to it but strangers often comment on how little I wear.

laloli
149
2012-08-08 12:16:12

Third half day of my snowy weekend (part I)

After warming up my body felt better but the I felt the cold much more than before and started almost immediately to shiver a bit when we went out. Frank told me then, that now I could do more than the baby hill and could go to the next easiest one. He pointed to a hill on the left. To me it seemed enormous and terribly steep and the people going down looked like total experts to me. He must have noticed my scared look and told me: "It's only 80m high, it's really for absolute beginners. You'll be able to do it." and guided me to the lift.

This time it was like a big fork for two people. You had to stand and when the fork came from behind you had to put it under your bum and it would drag you uphill. I was really happy to have Frank with me. Thank God the fork was plastic and not metal. Still it felt like sitting on ice when it touched my bare legs. Frank said "we will get off in the middle when it gets flat again." About halfway up there was indeed a flat part and he said go. OK, I managed to get off the lift but as I was still in movement I lost control again and fell flat into the snow. As I was really slow, it didn't hurt a lot, but gosh, the snow was cold.

Whilst I was struggling to get up again the next fork with two guys passed. They shouted something like "hey, the beach is over there and pointing in some direction." I wonder what they would have said if I were blond.

Frank helped me up and rubbed the snow from my body, that was nice of him. We looked down the hill. It seemed so, so steep and my heart was beating like crazy - good against the cold. Frank said "follow me" and slid about 10m down. I followed, and yes it worked! But only at first, I did a curve and didn't get it right. I started to go downhill very fast and at a point where it was a bit steeper I was suddenly in the air and fell flat on my belly, I lost my skis and started sliding slowly downwards on my front side with my head first. Everything happened so fast, my bikini bottom was ripped from my body, the knots at both sides had opened, and my top opened behind the neck and it went down to my waist. My poor nipples scratched over the frozen surface as well as my belly and thighs. This was painful, I can assure you.

Hundreds of thoughts ran through my mind: "How stupid can you be to get into this? What if I can't stop? Will my nipples freeze and break (completely idiotic - I know)? Will my skin be ripped off? Frank and everybody will think I'm a total idiot." etc

Suddenly I stopped. Frank was beside me and had grabbed my leg. He helped me turn around and I sat with my completely naked bum in the snow.

I sobbed a little and tried to calm down. Frank examined me whilst I was sitting there sniffing and shivering. After he saw that nothing really bad had happened to me, he asked me whether I wanted to go back to the restaurant or even to the house. I considered a moment, but then I said "no, I'm not the girl who gives up easily". I fixed my bikini top. It had suffered a bit but I still could put it on. My nipples were so hard, that they made an air cushion between skin and fabric around them.

Frank brought me the bikini bottom which was quite OK still. He helped me up and there I stood with shaking legs. I took a few deep breaths, took off my right glove, put it into my bikini bottom and squeezed my $%!@ and smiled at him: "OK, let's go $%!@!". He smiled back and shook his head whilst I put my glove back on "You are unbelievable" he said.

I started to slide down extremely carefully and slowly, Frank always by my side. I only fell once again at the end of the slope, but not like before. I was not that cold at the moment as it had been quite exhausting, yet my whole front side was still hurting somewhat because of the fall before. When we were heading towards the lift again we were stopped by two Italian guys who wanted a photo with me. I stood between them whilst Frank took photos with their mobiles. On the way to the lift he slapped my bum and said "you are really doing great!" I blushed a little, I have always been quite receptacle for compliments and a slap on the bum is also always appreciated.

On the lift again I started to shiver again and my teeth chattering. I still managed to get off it and also to slide down the slope (really slow again - but I didn't want to crash like before), this time without falling. I have to say, I started enjoying the skiing a bit but it was physically very tough. I guess when you are properly dressed it's not so hard. I mean, your body has to put a lot of energy into keeping it running without collapsing I think.

Again I managed to get off the lift again without falling but the slide down wasn't that successful this time. I had tried to go a little faster but my muscles didn't respond properly anymore as I was all tense from the constant shivering (I don't even talk about goosebumps - I had them constantly since we left the restaurant). So at about halfway down the hill and fell badly again but this time on my bum. Snow and ice can feel like fire but this time I was panicking less than before and, yeah, I didn't lose my bikini this time.

When I finally came to a halt, my bum cheeks hurt like hell and I had really difficulties to get back on my feet. My shivering had become less intense, I believe because of exhaustion. Frank said to me: "I think we should call it a day, you did fantastic but it's getting dark anyway and we've still got some plans for today." I nodded and he helped me going down the last meters of the slope.

We made a quick stop at the restaurant where I had another hot chocolate. That was good! This time we didn't stay too long and took the lift back to the valley. This time I had no problems getting off but whilst we were going down the sun got behind the mountains and suddenly it felt much, much colder when we were in the shadow.

Not only my whole body felt somewhat numb at this point but my mind too worked a lot slower than usual. That's why my memory is a little bit blurred about what happened next. I know we left the skiing stuff at the administration centre, that I was happy to get off the heavy boots and back into my sandals.

I completely lost my sense of time during the ride back in the car. I don't know if it took long or not. I remember sitting in my seat, freezing, my teeth chattering but I can't really say how I felt, whether we talked or if we listened to music. I was so happy I didn't have to drive. I would surely had an accident.

Frank helped me out of the car when we arrived at the chalet. He had to guide me into the house, undressed me and took me into the shower where he turned on the warm water. At first I screamed, as it felt like thousands of needles, as the warm water touched my ice cold skin - actually, as I said before, the water wasn't that warm, but in this moment it felt like if it were boiling.

After a while I began to enjoy it and the the normal feeling returned to my body and I regained control over my muscles.

I don't know how long I stayed in the shower but when I did it was almost completely dark outside. I felt much better but I felt all my muscles aching and my skin was covered all over with scratches and bruises, but nothing that wouldn't go away. I dried myself and put on lotions, perfume and make up and went naked to the living room where Frank expected me with a glass of schnapps.

I sat beside him on the sofa and sipped on the glass. He put his hand on my naked thigh and asked: "Ready for dinner?" I nodded and asked what I should put on. He answered "nothing, my dear. We're gonna have a picnic. No need to get dressed at all."

Curious about the picnic and how it went on? Today is such a beautiful day, so I'm going to spend it at the lake. I'll try to continue tomorrow. As always feedback and critique is very much appreciated!

zugger

2012-08-10 13:28:16

@bassdrummer:

Here's the thing: Whenever I find an interesting video or image somewhere I download it (hence I have a huge and badly sorted collection). "Freezing" is neither my only nor my primary fetish but I love to see naked or barely dressed good looking women in adverse weather. I really admire them for their endurance and their willingness to suffer for being sexy.

I searched a couple of times for "girl", "woman", "snow", "naked", "ice", "bare legs" and other related terms in different combinations. When I get to something interesting, I always look through the uploader's other videos, their subscriptions and favourites and so on, this usually leads to other interesting stuff, but not necessarily on the same topic.

So, in order to comply with your request (which I really want to do at some point, especially as others might also be interested) I can't just go and copy and paste my "freezing bookmarks" (I don't have anything like that - yet). No, I have to look through my subscriptions and find and copy the links. As many videos might have been deleted over the years I would also have to scan through my archive and upload the interesting stuff to some platform myself.

Besides that, I work about 10 hours per day, I have a wife and a daughter, friends and hobbies, I have to help in the household, do my tax return, repair our bikes etc. and we're looking for a house to buy. Looking through videos - either on disk or on the internet - is (for me) a rather private activity and you can possibly imagine how much time I have for myself, and then ask yourself how far up in my priority list this is, when I might also be reading a book, the news, watch a film on TV, take a bath or whatever else.

Yes, I'd love to post some links, but it might still take some time.

@shiverfan, @gfx, @laloli and all others: Your stories have been great and if you post more, you'll surely get great feedback from me and others!

laloli
164
2012-08-14 10:10:46

First of all: thanks to all for your lovely responses! They make it worth the time to continue writing. I'm not the fastest in typing and English is not my first language, that makes the whole thing quite an effort.

@daewongkim1994: OK, I now learned that teeth "chatter" not "shatter" - thanks for helping me improving my English.

I don't take many photos myself, sometimes I take a snapshot or a short video with my mobile, but it never really occurred to me to film myself in such a situation. Considering the large number of requests I'm getting, I think I should have done it - could have been fun and a small but considerable extra income.

Many clients have been taking photos or videos during some assignments, also on very cold days, but I don't have them. I don't know exactly what I'm going to do work wise in the future but I actually think I would like to do some erotic modeling. Shivering or freezing videos could be something I could specialize in. I don't mind very much feeling cold, there's surely a demand and apparently there are not too many girls doing it. I's not a decision I'm likely to take in the next weeks or so but I'll keep you posted.

As for your other questions:

How long would you say you would chatter your teeth before they would finally stop?

There's no general answer to that. As long as I'm really, really cold but still have force it can go on for a very long time. After half an hour or so my jaws begin to hurt. So it's often an on/off thing.

I wasn't constantly chattering and shivering. In times of great physical activity I wasn't. Goosebumps I had practically all the time, except when inside, shivering a lot - I'd say more than half of the time, teeth chattering after a lot of shivering until getting completely exhausted.

I'm curious though would you say you have a lot of hair on your arms or no

I have visible hair on my arms, but not a lot - otherwise I'd shave it like on my legs and on my $%!@.

Wow, what a person you are to go through all of this!!

Well, I thought the same about shiverfan's girlfriend. Maybe my assignments were physically more demanding but I'd definitely say that if I was in the fridge, she was deep frozen! I mean, she took hours and hours without physical activity, spent a lot of time in icy water and was constantly rubbed down with snow.

gfx
171
2012-08-21 19:58:22

One winter evening last year, me and my bf decided to go see a movie at this special theater. It was about 2 miles away. All I had on was a sleeveless pink dress and a 4-inch long white miniskirt that was so short that it was completely covered by the dress. I dress like this all the time but this time was definitely one of the coldest. Before we left our place, we heard on the radio that it was 35F outside extremely windy and with a high chance of rain but me and my bf decided against bringing an umbrella (my bf had a big coat on anyways). We decided to walk to the theater even though it was very far and I had to walk through a crowded part of NYC wearing next to nothing. By the time we got there, I was shivering with huge goosebumps and chattering teeth and my legs were bright red from the cold. During the walk, the wind blew the thin fabric of my dress and skirt up several times and the wind made my nipples poke out of my dress which feels really sexy. We watched the movie together with me still shivering from the cold the whole time.

After the movie, we walked out of the theater and saw everyone with umbrellas because there was extremely heavy rain. My bf suggested that we take the bus but I told him I didn't want to wait and would rather run home instead. We started to run but after a block, I couldn't run because my legs were starting to go numb from the cold and I had high heels on. The cold water dripped all over my ice cold body making me shake and shiver uncontrollably. My clothes and hair was completely wet so I basically felt ice cold everywhere. My bf asked if I wanted to go sit at this Korean restaurant that his friend works at and eat for a while but I told him I was on a diet. My bf tried to persuade me, telling me that I am skinny enough already at 5'10 and 110 lbs. But I told my bf I still had a bit of fat on my legs that I still want to get rid of so I can be even skinnier and after a while my bf complied. We walked through the heavy rain with me shaking every step from the cold. I got a lot of sexy stares from bypassers and one guy even offered me his umbrella but I declined it and told him I liked the feeling of cold rain on my skin lol

After a long walk, we finally got home. My bf said he loves me for being so tough and braving the cold for so long. I used up so much energy from shivering and chattering teeth that I just lied on my bed and fell asleep.

btw, guys I made a poll a while ago when I joined, would be nice if you check it out: http://www.misterpoll.com/polls/563228

You would be surprised at all the shocking faces and starring I get when I enter the bus :) I work for a Korean company and my boss is totally okay with me wearing miniskirt as long as it doesn't show my butt, in fact, he actually likes it and comments on my dressing style from time to time.

A thorough scrub all over with a nice firm body brush can make the treatment even more effective. As well for cold endurance the sudden contrast from hot to cold can be a real rush and intensely sensual: taking a hot bath then an ice cold shower, or a contrast shower, or maybe leaping into an ice cold shower immediately after waking up to really get your body going! I can also appreciate how refreshing it must be to, say, go for a run in really minimal clothes on a cold day, and jump into a cold shower afterwards. European spas offer a beauty treatment where you stand at the end of a short tunnel and get thoroughly hosed down (front and back) with a powerful high pressure cold water jet. I would like to hear from anyone who has experienced any of these things!

wildswimmer
210
2012-11-29 23:21:57

Two or three mornings a week I go for a run before breakfast. I wear a thin short running vest and running shorts. When I leave the house I wear flip-flops because the lane down to the fields from the end of our street is rather stony. Once I get to the fields though I hide the flip-flops in the long grass and continue barefoot. After ten minutes I'm by the river. I take off my vest, and slip into the water. In the summer it's lovely and cool – in the winter it is frigid. But each day throughout the autumn it's only a little colder each time than the last time, and last time it was OK so this time it's not so bad. I swim for up to ten minutes, often deciding to get out, then as I approach the bank turning round and swimming again, sometimes pulling my vest off the bank into the water with me. I climb out, put on my vest and run back across the fields. I never take a towel. In winter the grass is covered in frost, and the sun is just rising, often with a low red horizon and a deep blue sky. I can no longer feel my bare feet slapping the icy grass. Back at the path I put on my flip-flops for the run down the lane back to our street and home. Often I see no one at all during my run, sometimes just the odd dog-walker. Some of them look at me strangely, others, who have seen me before say a cheery hello.

Once home I have a shower. If I haven't run, this is also how I begin my day.

I always have a cold shower, the water turned right down – there is no hot water, just as it comes out of the cold tap. The pressure is high and the cold water pummels my skin. After the river in winter though, it feels slightly warmer. I start by spraying my legs, then my arms, once quickly round my waist and up my back. Then it's up the front, back on the hook and I'm standing right under it, the cold water running through my hair and all down my freezing body. I'm in there for maybe ten minutes, by which time I'm shaking and covered in goose bumps, even in the summer.

I only quickly get dry, with a quick wipe of the towel. I never dry my arms, instead putting on my short-sleeved top over my wet arms.

The cool kitchen actually feels fairly warm after the cold shower. I often go outside to eat my cereal in the garden barefoot, even in the frost. If I'm on a diet though the cereal goes and it's just a glass of fruit juice.

I drive to work – it takes nearly an hour each way. I never put the heater on, whatever the temperature, and often have the windows open. I used to have a soft top convertible and would put the top down unless it was raining, whatever the temperature. Of course I am only wearing my short-sleeved or sleeveless top, and there's no coat in the car at all.

I arrive at the office absolutely frozen. The stair handrail feels so warm even though it's probably only 18C. My desk is right opposite the air-conditioner outlet which blows cold air at me all day long.

The drive home is just as cold as the drive in and in winter in the dark I have the windows open the whole time. Once on a particularly snowy night I broke down and I had to wait an hour and a half in the cold and dark. The engine wouldn't start and pretty soon the car was icing up before I was rescued. Finally I reach my rather cool house for the evening.

If I go into town in the evening I never wear long sleeves. I always cycle in and home again. People sometimes stare, but I'm soon past and disappear into the dark.

I always sleep naked with no bed clothes and the window open, the cold night air flooding in like a waterfall over the bed. I can't sleep if I'm warm. Sometimes I wake up cold in the middle of the night but I soon drift off again. After a cold night's sleep I'm up again for my cold run and swim or my cold shower.

At the weekends I may go for a longer cycle ride into the countryside, always in shorts and short-sleeved or sleeveless top. I may stop off at a lake to go for a longer swim in the cool or cold water, then cycle home all wet. Once home I'll have a cold shower and some alcohol to warm me up.

ich kann mich an einen Tag im Winter erinnern da sagte eine freundin zu mir sollen wir mal etwas verrücktes machen ? ich sagte direkt was meinst du :) und sie was hälst du davon wenn ich im schnee mit dir im bikini spazieren gehen :) ich war verblüfft und freute mich gleichzeitig total... als der tag soweit war, war es furchtbar kalt und ein eisiger wind wehte, ich hatte eine dicke jacke an und mir war bitterlich kalt. Wir gingen um einen See der weg war ungefähr 5km lang nach der hälfte des Weges konnte sie kaum mehr laufen so am zittern war sie, als ich sie fragte ob ich das auto holen sollte sagte sie nur nein, ich schaffe das schon.....ihre gänsehaut war wunderschön anzusehen.....als wir wieder am auto waren und später zuhause brauchte sich fast 1,5h bis sie nicht mehr am zittern war und ihr langsam wärmer wurde. ok ... here goes ... i remember a day in winter when my girl friend asked me ... shall we do something crazy? i asked ... what do you have in mind? she replied ... what about we go for a walk in the snow, and i will only wear my bikini? i was stunned and excited at the same time. when our adventure started, it was a terribly cold day with an icy wind blowing. i wore a thick jacket and was still freezing. my girl was cold herself, but did not want to admit it at first. in the car, when she still wore a jacket on top, she was very cold already and had goose bumps all over. when we left the car and she dropped her jacket and pants, she was covered in goose bumps all over in a matter of seconds. plus she started shivering right away. she wore a yellow bikini and sexy high heels. we walked around a lake, about 5 kilometers. about half way into our walk, she could barely continue because her shivering got so frantic. i asked her if i should run to get the car but she declined and said she could handle the cold. her goose bumps were a gorgeous sight to behold. back to the car and on the way home, she needed about an hour and a half to stop shaking and started to get warm again slowly. it was an evening to always remember ...

gfx
227
2012-12-16 17:36:48

hi Ferfred, I'm doing fine :) I haven't been on here for a while because I was on a trip to South Korea with my bf and some other friends. It has been pretty cold there (10-20F). The only clothes I brought with me were miniskirts all shorter than 10 inches and paper thin see-through tank tops. Of course, my friend and cousins and sister had warmer clothes and all the guys had huge jackets. The moment I walked out of the airport, my whole body started shivering uncontrollably and my nipples were piercing through the thin fabric of my tank top. Midnight is pretty cold in South Korea. Now here comes the fun part. All of us got into the taxi and the driver kept trying to get a look at me through the car's mirror. Then, he asks me "Do you have pants on?" It was actually a pretty good question because my tank top entirely covered my micro mini skirt and you really couldn't tell. Over here, lot of girls wear mini skirts in the winter so I had to wear shorter ones to stand out :) Anyways, I told him I did and then he asked if I was some pop star he didn't know about lol He also complemented me on my long, thin legs and he was very interested at how I started dressing like this so I told him the whole story. Really cool taxi driver, hopefully I get a ride from him when I go to Korea again one day :)

@daewongkim

->Why do you enjoy being cold? What about it exactly turns you on? I mean, do you enjoy rubbing your arms and feeling goosebumps? Or hearing your teeth chatter?

I do not rub my arms, at least I try to suppress the urge as long as I can ;-). Same for chattering teeth. Maybe I enjoy just that, pretending everything is normal, and the bewildered reactions of people who cannot understand how I can be warm enough when at the same time my body shows obvious signs of freezing g. It is that contrast that makes things interesting. On the other hand, when I start to really freeze after some time outside and my shivering finally becomes uncontrollable, with chattering teeth, and chills running down my goosebumps, this adds another shot of adrenaline to my already considerable arousal from all the looks and comments ;-). At this point, when I can look sexy in skimpy clothes, I would never admit that my body is probably near or beyond its cold tolerance g, so it is also a kind of challenge for me to show my cold resistance by wearing next to nothing and showing as much as possible of my unprotected thin body ;-). Sounds weird, but it is fun!

->I noticed when you said you have "extra huge goosebumps" do you have a lot of arm hair? I know that generally the more hair a girl has on her arms, the bigger the goosebumps. Some girls I know have almost no hair and when they get cold just have small bumps all over, but other girls who have so much hair especially on their forearms, you can see the goosebumps a mile away

No, I do not have much hair on my arms to begin with, and I shave off the rest when I do my legs. However, my goosebumps are pretty big anyway. I think it depends on which skin type you are. Mine is the southernly naturally tanned type, rather smooth when I am warm, but when I get cold I get goosebumps easily, first soft and later huge, I am not sure whether you can see them from a mile away though, hehe.

->Do you ever take pictures or videos when you are cold?

Not on a regular basis, but my friends may have taken some private shots.

->Do you get goosebumps easily? Because I know people who could be shivering and chattering teeth but still have none, and others who at the slightest chill have their arms, back, legs, and chest covered in goosebumps, which is most of the time.

Yes I do. In fact, I feel the cold quite easily due to my skinny figure, there is not that much (actually still too much :-() insulating fat ;-). The first reaction of my body to a cold breeze is goosebumps erupting all over my skin. Later, when shivering and teeth chattering set in, they get considerably bigger and a reddish, then a bluish hue.

@Bf-Lena: "Yeah, I run barefoot down to about -5 Celsius, sometimes colder, but it depends how I feel at the moment.

@Wildswimmer: "When I leave the house I wear flip-flops because the lane down to the fields from the end of our street is rather stony. Once I get to the fields though I hide the flip-flops in the long grass and continue barefoot."

I run barefoot and bare-legged in winter as well (actually -10C is my limit to go barefoot). As you Wildswimmer do, I leave the house with shoes on then hide them when I reach the park: Canadian sidewalks are very corrosive in winter because all the chemical road salt they put on every part of concrete. At least parks are free of salt so I can run barefoot there.

@Wildswimmer: "I swim for up to ten minutes, often deciding to get out, then as I approach the bank turning round and swimming again, sometimes pulling my vest off the bank into the water with me."

I don't have any lake to swim in near my place, but I like the idea. Sometime in winter (around 0C) I plunge into a river with my clothes on, I love the feeling of wet clothes in winter that gives you much energy (furthermore, people who stare you because they see you wet in winter is funny ;)

@Bf-Lena:"This morning we had almost -20 so I had to wear clogs when I went into town. Not really bikini-weather! I wore a knee-length dress and a warm vest." "Well, at those temperatures you have to protect yourself a bit. The snow really burns under your feet and severe damage can occur."

I agree with you, bare feet, hands or head in -20 or -25C are a very bad idea. However bare legs are not a problem at all in such temperatures. I always go bare legged even in -25C plus windchill and don't feel the cold, I assume my legs are used to it in the same way as my face is used to it.

Hi Chilly!

It's been very cold in NY lately but I've been holding up, I currently have a cold right now but that's not stopping me!

Last Friday, during the blizzard, I had to run an errand in the middle of the blizzard and since my wardrobe only contained paper thin tank tops and miniskirts, I had no choice but to freeze and get hit by heavy rain! The moment I walked outside, my entire body was shivering and it was so cold, I got numb really quick. And that was actually a good thing because my thin bare arms and legs were so numb, I could barely feel the pain from the heavy rain/hail/snow falling on me! I remember multiple people stopped by and asked if I needed a jacket or something and I just said "no thank you but you should take yours off anyways" lol

I remember I was still shivering for like over an hour in my room after coming back from the blizzard even though my room was like 60F.

I am truly enjoying this winter, it feels so nice to go bare arms and bare legs in the freezing cold :) Now, I got so used to exposing my skin that a few days ago, when I had to wear formal clothes to a meeting, there was this weird feeling. Like idk, I get used to seeing my own goosebumps and shivering and for that hour, I really missed it lol

wildswimmer
287
2013-02-20 23:38:09

@gfx: You are wonderful! I'm still waiting for your "coldest hour" story too. Mine was a couple of weeks ago when I went for my usual morning run with a heavy frost. The field I run across was mainly ice which kept cracking under my feet and I kept losing my flip-flops (I don't go barefoot in ice like this as I've cut my feet before when I have). I swam in the river for ten minutes as usual and came out shaking. I plodded across the frozen field in my wet shorts and vest (I never take a towel). It was more and more effort to run or even walk and more than once I thought I might just collapse in the frost. But somehow I made it home where I had my usual cold shower. I was shaking all the way to work (an hour's drive) but I felt great!

Sometimes I find that I get so cold I need to get warm but the moment I cover my legs or turn up the car heating (to like 16C/62F, the minimum setting above just plain cold) I feel this strange repulsive feeling and I have to uncover my legs again or turn off the heating and open the windows. Then I get colder still but it feels so much better. The last few days I had to drive three hours north, where I knew it would be freezing, to train some customers. I took no coat or jacket or anything long-sleeved. So first thing in the morning I left the car in the hotel and walked across town in a short-sleeved shirt for half an hour with ice on the ground to my customer's place. I got lots of strange looks from people wrapped in down jackets, with hats and gloves on. The sun was shining and I enjoyed this wonderfully fresh cold morning. My customers asked me if I had a coat - I told them I'd left it in my own car and forgotten to transfer it to the hire car we have to use for long trips. On the long cold journey home I had the windows open most of the time with the icy wind blasting in. At least I never felt tired.

I switched from standing and sitting a few times during movie. my skin was bright red soaked and covered in goosebumps. as ice melted in tub he would add more to make sure I continued to freeze.

Shivering got uncontrollable below freezing the wetter I was and the longer out side the more uncontrollable it got with intense chattering teeth.

I was wet alot. Id have to start me day with a cold shower and then outside for a smoke. Not being able to dry. That would get the shivering started right away. After breakfast we would go for a hour long walk id wear heels with a small dress. My hair would still be damp half way through the walk is when it would start to get miserable with huge goosebumps and uncontrollable shivering. wildswimmer
332
2013-05-21 23:23:01

@goosebumps: It's really good to have someone else on this forum who enjoys being cold. There seem to be many guys on here who enjoy watching others (female) being cold or who enjoy reading about their cold adventures, but not so many who like being cold themselves, and fewer still who get turned on by it. Your adventures sound amazing - it must have been so nice to share them with someone, even though he didn't partake in the feelings. Your freezer room is a great idea - ice even in the summer! I'm looking forward to hearing more about your wonderfully cold exploits. Did you ever go skiing?

Before I discovered this forum I really thought I was a bit weird. Still now I've only ever told two people about my feelings and I don't see either of them now. People just think I don't feel the cold - of course I do, maybe not as much as most people but that's because I'm used to it now and it needs to be colder and colder now for me to actually feel cold. But if it's below 7C or so (what's that? 45F) I feel cold, but I don't cover up, because I like the feeling. So instead I actively seek out situations to make me cold, like my morning run and swim in the river, even in the winter, and never wearing long sleeves whatever the weather, and sleeping with the bedroom window open.

@lissy: It's good to have you back after a long silence. Like you I don't dry off after my morning swim in the cold river. I just run home again for a cold shower. I do sometimes wear flip-flops if it's frosty as I've cut my feet before on frosty ground, but otherwise go barefoot, even in soft snow.

@gfx: What I like about this forum is that you only have to reveal what you want to. No names, no photos, no more info than you want - and people use their imagination for the rest. I do only wear T-shirts and shorts, though I have to wear long trousers at work but then the aircon is on high there.

my first nude iceskating was a very cold experience

He suggested we go for a walk I was wearing a thin sundress temp was around 20 f sunny and a little breeze. I said sure. He asked if I would go bare foot with no coat. I never did that before but I agreed I been outside without coat and shoes before but not a long period of time yet. We set off and right a way I was covered in goosebumps after a little bit I was shivering pretty hard. We headed into a wooded area which I had to walk barefoot in the snow this was my first time for that and it was a shock I though the side walk was cold but the snow was much colder I had to take several breaks to rub my feet. After about 30 min about 10 on cement and 20 in the snow we got to a large river where there was no snow cover. He asked if id go ice skating I said I never had with my teeth chattering so hard. he pulled a pair of skates out of his back pack and asked me to try I was so relieved to have something on my feet. he said 1 condition for the skates I had to give him my dress. The dress was so short and thin it didn't offer any protection from the cold and wind and my feet were in such pain I agreed.
